samplePosts.title: Best coworking spaces in Seoul for developers
samplePosts.content:
I've been working remotely in Seoul for the past 6 months and wanted to share my favorite coworking spaces:

1. **Spark Labs** - Great startup community in Gangnam
2. **Maro29** - Beautiful cafe-style workspace in Itaewon
3. **Fast Track** - 24/7 access in Hongdae

Each has reliable high-speed internet and plenty of power outlets. Maro29 is my personal favorite for the atmosphere and coffee quality.

Pro tip: Most places offer day passes for around 20,000-30,000 KRW if you want to try before committing to a monthly plan.

samplePosts.content:

If you're interested, drop a comment or send me a message! Let's learn together.

samplePosts.title: New here! Introduction üëã
samplePosts.content:
Hello Konomads community!

I'm Alex, a software developer from Canada who's been living the nomad life for about a year now. So far I've worked from:

- Chiang Mai, Thailand (3 months)
- Da Nang, Vietnam (2 months)
- Seoul, South Korea (4 months)

Planning to explore Europe next - currently deciding between Lisbon and Medellin.

Excited to connect with other nomads here and share experiences! Feel free to reach out if you're in Seoul or planning to visit.

samplePosts.title: Weekend trip guide: Ayutthaya from Bangkok
samplePosts.content:
Just got back from an amazing weekend trip to Ayutthaya and wanted to share some tips for fellow nomads looking for a quick getaway from Bangkok!

## Getting There
- Take the train from Hua Lamphong Station (about 2 hours, 20 THB for 3rd class)
- Minivan from Victory Monument (about 1.5 hours, 60 THB)

## Must-See Temples
1. Wat Mahathat (famous Buddha head in tree roots)
2. Wat Chaiwatthanaram (stunning sunset views)
3. Wat Phra Si Sanphet (largest temple)

## Tips
- Rent a bicycle for the day (50 THB)
- Bring sun protection and water
- Go early morning to avoid crowds
- Stay for sunset at Chaiwatthanaram

Perfect way to recharge after a week of work!

samplePosts.title: Selling portable WiFi device - Seoul
samplePosts.content:
Hey everyone,

I'm leaving Seoul soon and selling my portable WiFi device. Great for nomads who need reliable internet on the go.

## Details
- Model: KT Egg 4G LTE
- Unlimited data
- Battery lasts 10+ hours
- Can connect up to 5 devices

## Price
- 50,000 KRW (originally 80,000 KRW)
- Bought 6 months ago, in excellent condition

Available for pickup in Hongdae or Gangnam. DM if interested!

First come, first served.

samplePosts.title: üì¢ Konomads Community Guidelines Update
samplePosts.content:
Hello community!

We've updated our community guidelines to ensure Konomads remains a welcoming and helpful space for all digital nomads. Here are the key updates:

## New Guidelines

1. **Be Respectful** - Treat all community members with kindness and respect

2. **Stay on Topic** - Posts should be relevant to digital nomad life, travel, and remote work

3. **No Spam** - Self-promotion should be limited and genuinely helpful

4. **Help Each Other** - Share knowledge, experiences, and resources freely

5. **Follow Local Laws** - When discussing visas, work permits, etc., always follow local regulations

## Reporting
You can report posts or comments that violate these guidelines. Our team will review all reports within 24 hours.

Thank you for being part of this amazing community! üåç‚ú®
